Unpoly [3.10.2](https://unpoly.com/changes/3.10.2) is now available.

To stay up to date, [watch GitHub Discussions](https://unpoly.com/community) or [follow on Twitter](https://twitter.com/unpolyjs).

Progressive enhancement for HTML
================================

Get powerful new HTML attributes to build dynamic UI on the server. Works with any language. Gracefully degrades without JavaScript.

[Get started](https://unpoly.com/tutorial) [Watch a demo](https://demo.unpoly.com/) or [read the long story](https://triskweline.de/unpoly-rugb/)

Links only update changed fragments

Unpoly enhances your links to [update fragments](https://unpoly.com/up.link) instead of full pages. This preserves other page state, like scroll positions or forms.

Master complex forms

Submit forms [without leaving the page](https://unpoly.com/up-submit). [Validate forms](https://unpoly.com/validation), [update dependent fields](https://unpoly.com/dependent-fields) and use [multi-step forms within modals](https://unpoly.com/subinteractions).

Branch off into layers

Branch off [subinteractions](https://unpoly.com/subinteractions) into [overlays](https://unpoly.com/up.layer). Return to the main page when you're done.

Outsmart server latency

Shorten response times by [preloading pages](https://unpoly.com/up-preload), [caching responses](https://unpoly.com/caching) and [following links earlier](https://unpoly.com/up-instant). Cached content is [kept fresh](https://unpoly.com/caching#revalidation) and [remains available when offline](https://unpoly.com/network-issues).

Client-side interaction feedback

Instantly show [placeholders](https://unpoly.com/placeholders), [disable forms](https://unpoly.com/disabling-forms) or define [arbitrary loading state](https://unpoly.com/previews). You can even do [optimistic rendering](https://unpoly.com/optimistic-rendering) with [client-side templates](https://unpoly.com/templates).

Organize your JavaScript snippets

Organize your Javascripts in [compilers](https://unpoly.com/up.compiler) to pair HTML elements with JavaScript behavior. Enhance existing HTML tags or create new elements.

Animation

[Animate page changes](https://unpoly.com/up.motion) with fade, swipe or zoom transitions.

Extensible

Hack and extend Unpoly using its comprehensive [render lifecycle](https://unpoly.com/render-lifecycle), [JavaScript API](https://unpoly.com/up.fragment) and [event model](https://unpoly.com/up.event).

Plays nice with existing code

Migrate any server-side web application with [manageable changes](https://unpoly.com/legacy-scripts) to existing JavaScripts.

Fix concurrency

Avoid real-world race conditions by [smart aborting](https://unpoly.com/aborting-requests), [batched validations](https://unpoly.com/dependent-fields#preventing-race-conditions) and [disabling submitted forms](https://unpoly.com/disabling-forms).
